experiments.name: A Week in the Life of a Browser

legacy.name: Toolbar Study
legacy.summary: We would like to have a better understanding of how Firefox's current toolbar is commonly used. How often do people click on the Back  button, how often do people switch search engines? The study data will be directly used to improve the toolbar design for Firefox 4.

legacy.name: Tab Open/Close Study
legacy.summary: Tabbed browsing is offered by all major web browsers. The first question we want to explore: what would be the best default browser behavior after users close or open a tab when many tabs are open?

legacy.name: Tab Switch Study
legacy.summary: This 5-day study aims to understand how people switch between tabs. The result of this study will help Firefox team design better ways for people to manage their tabs.

legacy.name: Menu Item Usage Study
legacy.summary: Remembering which username/password combination to use on a given site can be very frustrating. Firefox tries to help solve a part of this  problem with the Password Manager feature. Can it be more helpful?

legacy.name: Accounts and Passwords Study
legacy.summary: Remembering which username/password combination to use on a given site can be very frustrating. Firefox tries to help solve a part of this  problem with the Password Manager feature. Can it be more helpful?

legacy.name: How Do You Feel About Your Firefox Browser
legacy.summary: The aim of this survey is to understand users' perception on their Firefox browser in general over time. We will follow up a similar survey in a month to understand the change of user perception.

results.title: Min and Max Tabs
results.summary: How many tabs do users have open at a time?

results.title: Tab Lifespans
results.summary: How long does an individual tab stay open on average?

results.title: Switching on Tab Closure
results.summary: When a user closes a tab, Firefox automatically switches to another tab (call it the 'default' tab). Is this default tab usually the one that the user wants or not?

results.title: Bookmarks
results.summary: How many bookmarks do people use?

results.title: Bookmark  Folders
results.summary: How many folders do people use to manage their bookmarks?

results.title: Bookmark Levels
results.summary: How deep are those folders that people use to manage their bookmarks?

results.title: Password Amount
results.summary: How many passwords do people use?

results.title: Satisfaction: Accounts and Passwords Management
results.summary: How happy do people feel with current ways of managing accounts and passwords?

results.title: Password Reuse
results.summary: Do people repeat the same password on different sites?

results.title: Most Used Menu Items
results.summary: Which menu items are the most or the least commonly used?

results.title: Most Used Menu Items by Mouse Interaction
results.summary: What are most and least used Firefox menu items by only mouse interactions?

results.title: Most Used Menu Items by Mouse or Keyboard Shortcut
results.summary: Which menu items are the most or the least commonly used, by mouse click or keyboard shortcut?
